overview:
Roberto Moctezuma is currently an angel investor and board member of Suagi.com, an innovative startup focused on changing the nature of social video. He is also the CEO of a new startup focused on improving our world through the power of gaming.

In addition, Roberto is a board member at an emerging company in the mobile telecommunications market and provides business strategy advice and coaching to startups as part of the Advisory Board at the Houston Technology Center - with a focus on the IT sector.

Previously, Roberto was Vice President and General Manager of the Desktop Solutions Global Business Unit at Hewlett-Packard. In this role he was responsible for driving HPâ€™s client virtualization initiative and thin computing solutions, as well as creating new products and solutions for the Education, Retail and Visual Solutions markets. The product lines associated with these areas include hardware (Thin Clients, MultiSeat, Blade PC & Workstations, Point of Sale systems, Digital Signage) as well as application software (ThinPro, TeachNow, ImageManager, Device Manager, TeemTalk) and operating systems (ThinPro).

In this role Roberto executed the integration of Neoware, a company HP acquired in 2007, doubled the revenue associated with the business unit to $450M USD and extended HPâ€™s leadership to over 30% share of the global Thin Client market.

Prior to this, Roberto was the Vice President, Americas Volume Direct Operations at HP, which supports over $8 billion USD in revenue that flows through the HP Direct customer-to-cash cycle. There he was responsible for the Commercial Online Stores, Business-to-Business eCommerce, Sales and Presales Contact Center Operations and Order Management.

Before that, he led Operations and IT for all business lines of HP in Latin America, where he introduced Six Sigma concepts to improve speed and predictability of product delivery, reduced accounts receivables to free up over $80M USD, and transformed the organization to reduce cost more than 30 percent. During the HP/Compaq merger in 2002, Roberto drove the integration of all Internet, eCommerce and Contact Center assets of HP Latin America, which included over 17 contact centers and over 40 online platforms.

At Compaq Computer, he directed the eCommerce organization for Compaq in Latin America and led the sales, marketing and server business unit functions as the Mexico subsidiary grew its revenue over 300 percent in three years. He also managed sales and marketing teams for Digital Equipment Corporation in Mexico, co-founded a telecommunications startup that pioneered electronic fund transfers (EFT) applications in Mexico and served as head of the software development division for Grupo Infodinamica.

He has participated as keynote speaker and panelist at numerous industry events (Comdex, InternetWorld, Expomanagement), written a monthly column on Unix & Open Systems for Personal Computing magazine and been the radio host for a weekly program on IT News and Trends.

Robertoâ€™s academic background includes computer engineering and software development studies at the Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Mexico in Mexico City. He taught computer science at the Instituto Tecnologico Autonomo de Mexico and was a collaborating author of the â€œComputers & Programmingâ€ college textbook.
